greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction expansion of the constant (A114550) equal to the sum Sum_{n>=0} 1/A112373(n), such that the partial quotients satisfy: a(2n) = A112373(n) for n>0 and a(2n+1) = A112373(n+1)/A112373(n) for n>=0.
comment: A112373 is defined by the recurrence: let b(n) = A112373(n), then
link: A. Hone, Curious continued fractions, nonlinear recurrences and transcendental numbers, arXiv:1507.00063 [math.NT], 2015 and J. Int. Seq. 18 (2015) # 15.8.4.
formula: a(2n) = a(2n-1)*a(2n-2) for n>=2, a(2n+1) = a(2n)*a(2n-1) + a(2n-1) for n>=1, with a(0)=2, a(1)=a(2)=1. - _Jeffrey Shallit_.
example: The recurrence of partial quotients is demonstrated by:
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 08 2005
